snippet: With each of the 12 host cities now having hosted at least one game, it seems that organizers are toeing the line between normal logistical problems and a more irritating lack of preparedness.
abstract: Worst concerns about the World Cup in Brazil seem not to have materialized, though a number of logistical problems have arisen; inconveniences related to lack of preparedness have largely been eclipsed by a steady series of enthralling games.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Christopher Clarey, Andrew Das, Andrew Keh, Jeré Longman, Paula Ramón and David Waldstein.

lead_paragraph: With each of the 12 host cities now having hosted at least one game, it seems that organizers are toeing the line between normal logistical problems and a more irritating lack of preparedness.

headline.main: At the World Cup, Doomsday Predictions Give Way to Smaller Hiccups in Brazil
